TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/ToolBar/SplitButtonDropDown extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the drop-down portion of a combined regular button and drop-down button. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButtonDropDown class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the drop-down portion of a combined regular button and drop-down button.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButtonDropDown.HotChecked%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementToolBarSplitButtonDropDown6` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#269](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/c2111d5e-7aa2-4244-9b50-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#269](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/c2111d5e-7aa2-4244-9b50-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a split drop-down button in the checked state.
Docs.value: A that represents a split drop-down button in the checked state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Checked property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Checked property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementToolBarSplitButtonDropDown5` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#268](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/4bda5e55-e144-4170-9697-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#268](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/4bda5e55-e144-4170-9697-_1.vb)]
